function.name: text
function.description: Returns the text value of a node.

function.name: abs
function.description: Returns the absolute value of a given number. Returns the same type as the supplied argument.

function.name: QName
function.description: Constructs a QName value from a URI and local name. The second argument may be a lexical QName, and the prefix of the lexical QName is returned in the constructed value, for use if it is converted back to a string.

function.name: adjust-date-to-timezone
function.description: Returns a date value equivalent to the original date, but with the timezone removed.

function.name: adjust-date-to-timezone
function.description: Returns a date value equivalent to the original date, but with a different timezone.

function.name: adjust-dateTime-to-timezone
function.description: Returns a dateTime value equivalent to the original dateTime, but with the timezone removed.

function.name: adjust-dateTime-to-timezone
function.description: Returns a dateTime value equivalent to the original dateTime, but with a different timezone.

function.name: adjust-time-to-timezone
function.description: Returns a time value equivalent to the original time, but with the timezone removed.

function.name: adjust-time-to-timezone
function.description: Returns a time value equivalent to the original time, but with a different timezone.

function.name: avg
function.description: Returns the average of a set of numbers or durations

function.name: base-uri
function.description: Returns the base URI of the context node

function.name: base-uri
function.description: Returns the base URI of a given node

function.name: boolean
function.description: Obtains the effective boolean value of the supplied argument. The result is true if the argument value is a sequence starting with a node, or the singleton boolean true(), a singleton non-zero number, or a singleton non-zero-length string (or untypedAtomic). The result is false if the argument is an empty sequence, the singleton boolean false, a singleton number zero or NaN, or a singleton zero-length string (or untypedAtomic). In all other cases the result is an error.

function.name: ceiling
function.description: Rounds a value towards positive infinity

function.name: codepoint-equal
function.description: Compares two strings using the Unicode codepoint collation

function.name: codepoints-to-string
function.description: Converts a sequence of integers representing Unicode characters to the corresponding string. Throws an error if any of the integers doesn't represent a valid XML character. The set of valid XML characters depends on whether XML 1.0 or 1.1 is the chosen version in the Configuration.

function.name: collection
function.description: Returns the default collection if there is one.

function.name: collection
function.description: Loads an external collection of nodes identified by the URI of the collection

function.name: compare
function.description: Compares two strings using the default collation

function.name: compare
function.description: Compares two strings using a specified collation

function.name: concat
function.description: Concatenates the string-values of the arguments into a single string. There must be at least two arguments.

function.name: contains
function.description: Returns true if the second string is a substring of the first

function.name: contains
function.description: Returns true the second string is a substring of the first, under the rules of the chosen collation. This must correspond to a RuleBaseCollator.

function.name: count
function.description: Counts the number of items in a sequence

function.name: current
function.description: Returns the item that was the current item supplied on entry to the XPath expression

function.name: current-date
function.description: Returns the current date

function.name: current-dateTime
function.description: Returns the current date and time. Note that this does not change during the execution of the query or transformation.

function.name: current-group
function.description: Returns the contents of the current group selected by xsl:for-each-group

function.name: current-grouping-key
function.description: Returns the value that is the grouping key of the current group selected by xsl:for-each-group

function.name: current-time
function.description: Returns the current time. Note that this does not change during the execution of the query or transformation.

function.name: data
function.description: Returns the result of atomizing the supplied sequence

function.name: dateTime
function.description: Combines the given date and time. The result has a timezone if either of the inputs has a timezone; if they both have a timezone, then the two timezones must be the same.

function.name: day-from-date
function.description: Extracts the day component of a date value

function.name: day-from-dateTime
function.description: Extracts the day component of a dateTime value

function.name: days-from-duration
function.description: Extracts the days component of a dayTimeDuration value

function.name: deep-equal
function.description: Compares two sequences for deep equality; string values are compared using the default collation; nodes are compared for deep equality of names and content.

function.name: deep-equal
function.description: Compares two sequences for deep equality; string values are compared using the named collation; nodes are compared for deep equality of names and content.

function.name: default-collation
function.description: Returns the name of the default collation. If no collation has been set explicitly this will be the URI of the Unicode codepoint collation.

function.name: distinct-values
function.description: Returns the set of distinct values present in a given sequence. The current Saxon implementation returns the values in "order of first appearance", but it cannot be assumed that this will always remain the case.

function.name: distinct-values
function.description: Returns the set of distinct values present in a given sequence, comparing strings using a named collation. The current Saxon implementation returns the values in "order of first appearance", but it cannot be assumed that this will always remain the case.

function.name: doc
function.description: Loads a document identified by its URI

function.name: doc-available
function.description: Returns true if a document with the given URI can be successfully loaded, false otherwise.

function.name: document
function.description: Loads one or more documents identified by their URIs. URIs are handled by the URIResolver in the same way as the doc() function.

function.name: document
function.description: Loads one or more documents identified by their URIs, using the base URI of the node given in the second argument to resolve any relative URIs. URIs are handled by the URIResolver in the same way as the doc() function.

function.name: document-uri
function.description: Returns the URI of a document

function.name: element-available
function.description: Determines whether a particular instruction (typically, an extension element) is available for use in a stylesheet

function.name: empty
function.description: Returns true if the given sequence is empty

function.name: encode-for-uri
function.description: Applies the %HH escaping convention to a URI, escaping both disallowed characters and reserved characters such as "/" and ":"

function.name: ends-with
function.description: Returns true if the first string ends with the second string

function.name: ends-with
function.description: Returns true if the first string ends with the second string, when compared using the named collation. This must be a collation based on a RuleBasedCollator.

function.name: error
function.description: Raises an error.

function.name: error
function.description: Raises an error.

function.name: error
function.description: Raises an error.

function.name: error
function.signature: error($error as xs:QName?, $description as xs:string, $error-object as item()*)
function.description: Raises an error.

function.name: escape-html-uri
function.description: Applies the %HH escaping convention to a URI, according to the rules of the HTML specification: that is, non-ASCII characters are escaped, but all ASCII characters, including spaces, are retained intact.

function.name: exactly-one
function.description: Checks whether $srcval contains exactly one item; fails if it is empty or contains multiple items.

function.name: exists
function.description: Returns true if the given sequence is not empty

function.name: false
function.description: Returns the boolean value false

function.name: floor
function.description: Rounds a number towards minus infinity

function.name: format-date
function.description: Formats a date, using a format controlled by the picture string. The result is equivalent to the 5-argument form of the function, with the third, fourth, and fifth arguments set to an empty sequence.

function.name: format-date
function.signature: format-date(xs:date value, string picture, string language)
function.description: Formats a date, using a format controlled by the picture string. If no language is specified, the value is taken from the current Java locale. If the language (explicitly supplied or defaulted) is other than "en", the system tries to locate a class named net.sf.saxon.number.Numberer_XX where XX is the language; this class must provide methods to perform the localization.

function.name: format-dateTime
function.description: Formats a dateTime, using a format controlled by the picture string. The result is equivalent to the 5-argument form of the function, with the third, fourth, and fifth arguments set to an empty sequence.

function.name: format-dateTime
function.signature: format-dateTime(xs:dateTime value, string picture,string language,string calendar,string country)
function.description: Formats a date, using a format controlled by the picture string. If no language is specified, the value is taken from the current Java locale. If the language (explicitly supplied or defaulted) is other than "en", the system tries to locate a class named net.sf.saxon.number.Numberer_XX where XX is the language; this class must provide methods to perform the localization.

function.name: format-number
function.description: Formats a number as specified by a picture string, using the default decimal format

function.name: format-number
function.description: Formats a number as specified by a picture string, using a named decimal format

function.name: format-time
function.description: Formats a date, using a format controlled by the picture string. If no language is specified, the value is taken from the current Java locale. If the language (explicitly supplied or defaulted) is other than "en", the system tries to locate a class named net.sf.saxon.number.Numberer_XX where XX is the language; this class must provide methods to perform the localization.

function.name: format-time
function.description: Formats a time, using a format controlled by the picture string. This has the same effect as calling the 5-argument form of the function with an empty sequence supplied for the last three arguments.

function.name: function-available
function.description: Determines whether a function with a given name (regardless of arity) is available in the context

function.name: function-available
function.description: Determines whether a function with the given name and arity is available in the context.

function.name: generate-id
function.description: Returns a generated unique ASCII identifier for the context node

function.name: generate-id
function.description: Returns a generated unique ASCII identifier for a given node

function.name: hours-from-dateTime
function.description: Extracts the hour component of a dateTime value

function.name: hours-from-duration
function.description: Extracts the hours component of a dayTimeDuration value

function.name: hours-from-time
function.description: Extracts the hours component of a time value. Note that this is from the localized value, not the normalized value: for example if the supplied time value is 01:23:00+05:00 then the result is 1.

function.name: id
function.description: Finds the elements with given ID attribute values

function.name: id
function.description: Finds the elements with given ID attribute values, within a specified document.

function.name: idref
function.description: Finds the nodes that link to the element with a given ID value. These will be element or attribute nodes marked by virtue of schema or DTD validation as IDREF or IDREFS values.

function.name: idref
function.description: Finds the elements that link to the element with a given ID value. These will be element or attribute nodes marked by virtue of schema or DTD validation as IDREF or IDREFS values.

function.name: implicit-timezone
function.description: Returns the implicit timezone. By default, the implicit timezone in Saxon is the timezone taken from the system clock at the time the Configuration object is instantiated. This ensures that the implicit timezone is known at compile time.

function.name: in-scope-prefixes
function.description: Returns the names of the namespaces that are in scope for an element. Except for the unnamed namespace, which is represented by the string "", the names will be of type xs:NCName.

function.name: index-of
function.description: Finds the positions of items in a sequence that match the second argument

function.name: index-of
function.description: Finds the positions of items in a sequence that match the second argument, using a named collation for the comparison

function.name: insert-before
function.description: Insert an item into a sequence

function.name: iri-to-uri
function.description: Applies the %HH escaping convention to a URI, escaping only disallowed characters (but not reserved characters such as "/" and ":")

function.name: key
function.description: Returns the nodes identified by a named key declaration in the stylesheet.

function.name: key
function.description: Returns the nodes identified by a named key declaration in the stylesheet. The nodes selected are those that have a matching key-value, and that are within the subtree rooted at $root-node (which will generally be either a document node or an element)

function.name: lang
function.description: Returns true if the xml:lang value for the context node matches the given language

function.name: lang
function.description: Returns true if the xml:lang value for the given node matches the given language

function.name: last
function.description: Returns the context size (the size of the sequence of items currently being processed)

function.name: local-name
function.description: Returns the local part of the name of the context node

function.name: local-name
function.description: Returns the local part of the name of a given node

function.name: local-name-from-QName
function.description: Extracts the local name component of a QName value, as an xs:NCName

function.name: lower-case
function.description: Translates characters in a string to lower case

function.name: matches
function.description: Returns true if the given string matches the given regular expression

function.name: matches
function.description: Returns true if the given string matches the given regular expression, specifying flags to control the way pattern matching is performed

function.name: max
function.description: Returns the highest value in a sequence of comparable items

function.name: max
function.description: Returns the highest value in a sequence of strings, using a specified collation to perform the comparisons

function.name: min
function.description: Returns the lowest value in a sequence of comparable items

function.name: min
function.description: Returns the lowest value in a sequence of strings, using a specified collation to perform the comparisons

function.name: minutes-from-dateTime
function.description: Extracts the minutes component of a dateTime value

function.name: minutes-from-duration
function.description: Extracts the minutes component of a dayTimeDuration value

function.name: minutes-from-time
function.description: Extracts the minutes component of a time value

function.name: month-from-date
function.description: Extracts the month component of a date value

function.name: month-from-dateTime
function.description: Extracts the month component of a dateTime value

function.name: months-from-duration
function.description: Extracts the months component of a yearMonthDuration value

function.name: name
function.description: Returns the name of the context node, as a string in the lexical form of a QName

function.name: name
function.description: Returns the name of a given node, as a string in the lexical form of a QName

function.name: namespace-uri
function.description: Returns the namespace URI of the name of the context node

function.name: namespace-uri
function.description: Returns the namespace URI of the name of a given node

function.name: namespace-uri-for-prefix
function.description: Returns the namespace URI corresponding to a given prefix, using the namespaces that are in scope for a given element

function.name: namespace-uri-from-QName
function.description: Extracts the namespace URI component of a QName value

function.name: nilled
function.description: Returns true if the argument is an element that has the "nilled" property.

function.name: node-name
function.description: Returns the name of the given node, as a QName value (that is, a namespace URI plus local name)

function.name: normalize-space
function.description: Eliminates redundant spaces from the string value of the context item

function.name: normalize-space
function.description: Eliminates redundant spaces from a string

function.name: normalize-unicode
function.description: Converts a string to Unicode normalized form NFC by modifying the way in which combining characters are represented

function.name: normalize-unicode
function.description: Converts a string to a given Unicode normalized form by modifying the way in which combining characters are represented

function.name: not
function.description: Returns true if the effective boolean value of the argument is false, and vice versa

function.name: number
function.description: Equivalent to number(.)

function.name: number
function.description: Converts the given value to a number, after atomization if necessary. Returns NaN if conversion is not possible.

function.name: one-or-more
function.description: Tests whether $srcval contains one or more items; fails if it is an empty sequence.

function.name: position
function.description: Returns the context position (that is, the position of the context item in the sequence currenly being processed)

function.name: prefix-from-QName
function.description: Extracts the prefix component of a QName value. Returns an empty sequence if the QName has no prefix.

function.name: regex-group
function.description: Returns the contents of the substring that matched the n'th subexpression in a regular expression processed using xsl:analyze-string

function.name: remove
function.description: Removes the item at a given position in a sequence

function.name: replace
function.description: Replaces sequences of characters within a string that match a given regular expression

function.name: replace
function.description: Replaces sequences of characters within a string that match a given regular expression, specifying flags to control the way the regular expression is matched

function.name: resolve-QName
function.description: Expands a lexical QName using the in-scope namespaces from the given element

function.name: resolve-uri
function.description: Resolves a relative URI against the base URI from the static context

function.name: resolve-uri
function.description: Resolves a relative URI against a given base URI

function.name: reverse
function.description: Reverses the order of the items in the input sequence.

function.name: root
function.description: Returns the root node (typically but not necessarily a document node) of the tree containing the context node

function.name: root
function.description: Returns the root node (typically but not necessarily a document node) of the tree containing the given node

function.name: round
function.description: Rounds a numeric value to the nearest whole number, rounding x.5 towards positive infinity.

function.name: round-half-to-even
function.description: Rounds a numeric value to the nearest whole number, rounding x.5 towards the nearest even number.

function.name: round-half-to-even
function.description: Rounds a numeric value to the nearest integer multiple of 10 the power of minus precision, rounding x.5 towards the nearest number whose last digit is even.

function.name: seconds-from-dateTime
function.description: Extracts the seconds component of a dateTime value

function.name: seconds-from-duration
function.description: Extracts the seconds component of a dayTimeDuration value

function.name: seconds-from-time
function.description: Extracts the seconds component of a time value

function.name: starts-with
function.description: Tests whether one string starts with another string

function.name: starts-with
function.description: Tests whether one string starts with another string, using the given collation for comparison

function.name: static-base-uri
function.description: Returns the base URI of the static context

function.name: string
function.description: Returns the string value of the context node

function.name: string
function.description: Returns the string value of the argument. Saxon implements the argument as type item()* rather than item()?

function.name: string-join
function.description: Concatenates all the strings in the given sequence, separated by the given separator

function.name: string-length
function.description: Returns the number of characters in the string value of the context item

function.name: string-length
function.description: Returns the number of characters in the given string

function.name: string-to-codepoints
function.description: Returns a sequence of integers representing the Unicode codepoints of the characters in the supplied string

function.name: subsequence
function.description: Returns those items in the given sequence from the given starting position to the end of the sequence

function.name: subsequence
function.description: Returns those items in the given sequence from the given starting position up to the position implied by the given length

function.name: substring
function.description: Returns a substring of a given string starting at the given starting position and continuing to the end of the string

function.name: substring
function.description: Returns a subtring of a given string, starting at a given position and continuing up to a given length

function.name: substring-after
function.description: Returns that part of the given input string that occurs after the first occurrence of the string given in $operand2

function.name: substring-after
function.description: Returns that part of the given input string that occurs after the first occurrence of the string given in $operand2, using the given collation to compare strings

function.name: substring-before
function.description: Returns that part of the given input string that occurs before the first occurrence of the string given in $operand2

function.name: substring-before
function.description: Returns that part of the given input string that occurs before the first occurrence of the string given in $operand2, using the given collation to compare strings

function.name: sum
function.description: Returns the total of a sequence of numbers or durations

function.name: sum
function.description: Returns the total of a sequence of numbers, specifying the value to be returned for an empty sequence

function.name: system-property
function.description: Returns the value of a system property

function.name: timezone-from-date
function.description: Extracts the timezone component of a date value

function.name: timezone-from-dateTime
function.description: Extracts the timezone component of a dateTime value

function.name: timezone-from-time
function.description: Extracts the timezone component of a time value

function.name: tokenize
function.description: Returns a sequence of strings formed by breaking the input string at any substring that matches the given regular expression

function.name: tokenize
function.description: Returns a sequence of strings formed by breaking the input string at any substring that matches the given regular expression, using flags to control the way regular expression matching is performed

function.name: trace
function.description: Returns the value of the first argument after outputting a diagnostic message

function.name: translate
function.description: Returns a string formed by replacing individual characters that appear in the second argument with the characters that appear at the corresponding position in the third argument

function.name: true
function.description: Return the boolean value true

function.name: type-available
function.description: Determines whether a type with a given name is available in the static context. The current implementation has a restriction: if the argument is known only at run-time, then the function tests whether the type exists in the run-time configuration, which does not necessarily prove that it was present in the static context.

function.name: unordered
function.description: Returns a random permutation of its argument

function.name: unparsed-entity-public-id
function.description: Return the public ID of an unparsed entity, given its name

function.name: unparsed-entity-uri
function.description: Return the system ID of an unparsed entity, given its name

function.name: unparsed-text
function.description: Returns the contents of an external text file, given its URI. Saxon attempts to infer the encoding. First it looks in the HTTP headers if available. Then it examines the start of the file looking first for a byte-order-mark, and failing that for an XML declaration. If none of this works, it assumes the encoding is UTF-8.

function.name: unparsed-text
function.description: Returns the contents of an external text file, given its URI and encoding

function.name: unparsed-text-available
function.description: Determines whether the corresponding call on unparsed-text() would succeed.

function.name: unparsed-text-available
function.description: Determines whether the corresponding call on unparsed-text() would succeed.

function.name: upper-case
function.description: Converts a string to upper case

function.name: year-from-date
function.description: Extracts the year component of a date value

function.name: year-from-dateTime
function.description: Extracts the year component of a dateTime value

function.name: years-from-duration
function.description: Extracts the years component of a yearMonthDuration value

function.name: zero-or-one
function.description: Tests whether $srcval contains zero or one items; fails if it contains multiple items.
